org.apache.juneau.rest

Class RestServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • org.apache.juneau.rest.RestServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Servlet, ServletConfig
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RestServletDefault, RestServletJenaDefault

    public abstract class RestServlet
extends HttpServlet
    Servlet implementation of a REST resource.

    Refer to REST Servlet API for information about using this class.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • init

        public void init(ServletConfig servletConfig)

        Specified by:

        init in class GenericServlet
        Throws:

      • createChildrenMap

        protected Map<String,RestServlet> createChildrenMap()
                                             throws Exception
        Creates the child resources of this resource.

        Default implementation calls createChildren() and uses the @RestResource.path() annotation on each child to identify the subpath for the resource which become the keys in this map. It then calls the setParent(RestServlet) method on the child resource.

        Subclasses can override this method to programatically create child resources without using the @RestResource.children() annotation. When overridding this method, you are responsible for calling setParent(RestServlet) on the child resources.

        Returns:
        The new mutable list of child resource instances.
        Throws:
        Exception - If an error occurred during servlet instantiation.

      • createChildren

        protected List<RestServlet> createChildren()
                                    throws Exception
        Creates instances of child resources for this servlet.

        Default implementation uses the @RestResource.children() annotation to identify and instantiate children.

        Subclasses can override this method to programatically create child resources without using the @RestResource.children() annotation.

        Returns:
        The new mutable list of child resource instances.
        Throws:
        Exception - If an error occurred during servlet instantiation.

      • getChildClasses

        protected Class<?>[] getChildClasses()
                              throws Exception
        Programmatic equivalent to the @RestResource.children() annotation.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide customized list of child resources. (e.g. different children based on values specified in the config file).

        Default implementation simply returns the value from the @RestResource.children() annotation.

        Returns:
        The new mutable list of child resource instances.
        Throws:
        Exception - If an error occurred during servlet instantiation.

      • createProperties

        protected ObjectMap createProperties()
        Creates the class-level properties associated with this servlet.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own class-level properties for this servlet, typically by calling super.createProperties() and appending to the map. However, in most cases, the existing set of properties can be added to by overridding getProperties() and appending to the map returned by super.getProperties()

        By default, the map returned by this method contains the following:

        • Servlet-init parameters.
        • RestResource.properties() annotations in parent-to-child order.
        • SerializerContext.SERIALIZER_relativeUriBase from ServletConfig.getServletContext().
        Returns:
        The resource properties as an ObjectMap.

      • createBeanFilters

        protected Class<?>[] createBeanFilters()
        Creates the class-level bean filters associated with this servlet.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own class-level bean filters for this servlet.

        By default, returns the bean filters specified through the @RestResource.beanFilters() annotation in child-to-parent order. (i.e. bean filters will be applied in child-to-parent order with child annotations overriding parent annotations when the same filters are applied).

        Returns:
        The new set of transforms associated with this servet.

      • createPojoSwaps

        protected Class<?>[] createPojoSwaps()
        Creates the class-level POJO swaps associated with this servlet.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own class-level POJO swaps for this servlet.

        By default, returns the transforms specified through the @RestResource.pojoSwaps() annotation in child-to-parent order. (i.e. POJO swaps will be applied in child-to-parent order with child annotations overriding parent annotations when the same swaps are applied).

        Returns:
        The new set of transforms associated with this servet.

      • createBeanContext

        protected BeanContext createBeanContext(ObjectMap properties,
                                        Class<?>[] beanFilters,
                                        Class<?>[] pojoSwaps)
                                 throws Exception
        Creates the BeanContext object used for parsing path variables and header values.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own specialized bean context.

        Parameters:
        properties - Servlet-level properties returned by createProperties().
        beanFilters - Servlet-level bean filters returned by createBeanFilters().
        pojoSwaps - Servlet-level POJO swaps returned by createPojoSwaps().
        Returns:
        The new bean context.
        Throws:
        Exception - If bean context not be constructed for any reason.

                                                            Class<?>[] beanFilters,
                                                            Class<?>[] pojoSwaps)
                                                     throws Exception
        Creates the URL-encoding serializer used for serializing object passed to Redirect.

        Parameters:
        properties - Servlet-level properties returned by createProperties().
        beanFilters - Servlet-level bean filters returned by createBeanFilters().
        pojoSwaps - Servlet-level POJO swaps returned by createPojoSwaps().
        Returns:
        The new URL-Encoding serializer.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the serializer could not be constructed for any reason.

                                                    Class<?>[] beanFilters,
                                                    Class<?>[] pojoSwaps)
                                             throws Exception
        Creates the URL-encoding parser used for parsing URL query parameters.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own specialized parser.

        Parameters:

        beanFilters - Servlet-level bean filters returned by createBeanFilters().

      • createSerializers

        protected SerializerGroup createSerializers(ObjectMap properties,
                                            Class<?>[] beanFilters,
                                            Class<?>[] pojoSwaps)
                                     throws Exception
        Creates the serializer group containing serializers used for serializing output POJOs in HTTP responses.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own set of serializers for this servlet. They can do this by either creating a new SerializerGroup from scratch, or appending to the group returned by super.createSerializers().

        By default, returns the serializers defined through @RestResource.serializers() on this class and all parent classes.

        Parameters:
        properties - Servlet-level properties returned by createProperties().
        beanFilters - Servlet-level bean filters returned by createBeanFilters().
        pojoSwaps - Servlet-level POJO swaps returned by createPojoSwaps().
        Returns:
        The group of serializers.
        Throws:
        Exception - If serializer group could not be constructed for any reason.

      • createParsers

        protected ParserGroup createParsers(ObjectMap properties,
                                    Class<?>[] beanFilters,
                                    Class<?>[] pojoSwaps)
                             throws Exception
        Creates the parser group containing parsers used for parsing input into POJOs from HTTP requests.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own set of parsers for this servlet. They can do this by either creating a new ParserGroup from scratch, or appending to the group returned by super.createParsers().

        By default, returns the parsers defined through @RestResource.parsers() on this class and all parent classes.

        Parameters:
        properties - Servlet-level properties returned by createProperties().
        beanFilters - Servlet-level bean filters returned by createBeanFilters().
        pojoSwaps - Servlet-level POJO swaps returned by createPojoSwaps().
        Returns:
        The group of parsers.
        Throws:
        Exception - If parser group could not be constructed for any reason.

      • createConverters

        protected RestConverter[] createConverters(ObjectMap properties)
                                    throws RestServletException
        Creates the class-level converters associated with this servlet.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own class-level converters for this servlet.

        By default, returns the converters specified through the @RestResource.converters() annotation in child-to-parent order. (e.g. converters on children will be called before converters on parents).

        Parameters:
        properties - Servlet-level properties returned by createProperties().
        Returns:
        The new set of transforms associated with this servet.
        Throws:
        RestServletException

      • createEncoders

        protected EncoderGroup createEncoders(ObjectMap properties)
                               throws RestServletException
        Creates the EncoderGroup for this servlet for handling various encoding schemes.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own encoder group, typically by appending to the group returned by super.createEncoders().

        By default, returns a group containing IdentityEncoder.INSTANCE and all encoders specified through @RestResource.encoders() annotations in parent-to-child order.

        Parameters:
        properties - Servlet-level properties returned by createProperties().
        Returns:
        The new encoder group associated with this servet.
        Throws:
        RestServletException

      • createGuards

        protected RestGuard[] createGuards(ObjectMap properties)
                            throws RestServletException
        Creates the class-level guards associated with this servlet.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own class-level guards for this servlet.

        By default, returns the guards specified through the @RestResource.guards() annotation in child-to-parent order. (i.e. guards on children will be called before guards on parents).

        Parameters:
        properties - Servlet-level properties returned by createProperties().
        Returns:
        The new set of guards associated with this servet.
        Throws:
        RestServletException

      • createMimetypesFileTypeMap

        protected MimetypesFileTypeMap createMimetypesFileTypeMap(ObjectMap properties)
        Creates an instance of MimetypesFileTypeMap that is used to determine the media types of static files.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own mappings, or augment the existing map by appending to super.createMimetypesFileTypeMap()

        Parameters:
        properties - Servlet-level properties returned by createProperties().
        Returns:
        A new reusable MIME-types map.

      • createDefaultRequestHeaders

        protected Map<String,String> createDefaultRequestHeaders(ObjectMap properties)
                                                  throws RestServletException
        Creates the set of default request headers for this servlet.

        Default request headers are default values for when HTTP requests do not specify a header value. For example, you can specify a default value for Accept if a request does not specify that header value.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own class-level default request headers for this servlet.

        By default, returns the default request headers specified through the @RestResource.defaultRequestHeaders() annotation in parent-to-child order. (e.g. headers defined on children will override the same headers defined on parents).

        Parameters:
        properties - Servlet-level properties returned by createProperties().
        Returns:
        The new set of default request headers associated with this servet.
        Throws:
        RestServletException

      • createDefaultResponseHeaders

        protected Map<String,Object> createDefaultResponseHeaders(ObjectMap properties)
                                                   throws RestServletException
        Creates the set of default response headers for this servlet.

        Default response headers are headers that will be appended to all responses if those headers have not already been set on the response object.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own class-level default response headers for this servlet.

        By default, returns the default response headers specified through the @RestResource.defaultResponseHeaders() annotation in parent-to-child order. (e.g. headers defined on children will override the same headers defined on parents).

        Parameters:
        properties - Servlet-level properties returned by createProperties().
        Returns:
        The new set of default response headers associated with this servet.
        Throws:
        RestServletException

      • createResponseHandlers

        protected ResponseHandler[] createResponseHandlers(ObjectMap properties)
                                            throws RestException
        Creates the class-level response handlers associated with this servlet.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own class-level response handlers for this servlet.

        By default, returns the handlers specified through the @RestResource.responseHandlers() annotation in parent-to-child order. (e.g. handlers on children will be called before handlers on parents).

        Parameters:
        properties - Servlet-level properties returned by createProperties().
        Returns:
        The new set of response handlers associated with this servet.
        Throws:
        RestException

      • getSwaggerFromFile

        protected Swagger getSwaggerFromFile(Locale locale)
                              throws RestException
        Returns the localized Swagger from the file system.

        Looks for a file called "{ServletClass}_{locale}.json" in the same package as this servlet and returns it as a parsed Swagger object.

        Returned objects are cached for later quick-lookup.

        Parameters:
        locale - The locale of the swagger.
        Returns:
        The parsed swagger object, or null if the swagger file could not be found.
        Throws:
        RestException

        Returns:

      • createRequest

        protected RestRequest createRequest(HttpServletRequest req)
                             throws ServletException
        Creates a RestRequest object based on the specified incoming HttpServletRequest object.

        Subclasses may choose to override this method to provide a specialized request object.

        Parameters:
        req - The request object from the service(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) method.
        Returns:
        The wrapped request object.
        Throws:
        ServletException - If any errors occur trying to interpret the request.

      • createResponse

        protected RestResponse createResponse(RestRequest req,
                                      HttpServletResponse res)
                               throws ServletException
        Creates a RestResponse object based on the specified incoming HttpServletResponse object and the request returned by createRequest(HttpServletRequest).

        Subclasses may choose to override this method to provide a specialized response object.

        Parameters:
        req - The request object returned by createRequest(HttpServletRequest).
        res - The response object from the service(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) method.
        Returns:
        The wrapped response object.
        Throws:
        ServletException - If any erros occur trying to interpret the request or response.

      • hasOptionsPage

        public boolean hasOptionsPage()
        Returns whether this resource class can provide an OPTIONS page.

        By default, returns false.

        Subclasses can override this method to cause the options link to show up in the HTML serialized output.

        Returns:
        true if this resource has implemented a getOptions() method.

                               Object value)
        Specify a class-level property.

        Typically, properties in RestServletContext can be set in the Servlet.init(ServletConfig) method.

        Parameters:
        key - The property name.
        value - The property value.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

             throws ServletException,

      • handleNotFound

        protected void handleNotFound(int rc,
                              RestRequest req,
                              RestResponse res)
                       throws Exception
        Handle the case where a matching method was not found.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide a 2nd-chance for specifying a response. The default implementation will simply throw an exception with an appropriate message.

        Parameters:
        rc - The HTTP response code.
        req - The HTTP request.
        res - The HTTP response.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • renderError

        protected void renderError(HttpServletRequest req,
                           HttpServletResponse res,
                           RestException e)
                    throws IOException
        Method for rendering response errors.

        The default implementation renders a plain text English message, optionally with a stack trace if RestServletContext.REST_renderResponseStackTraces is enabled.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own custom error response handling.

        Parameters:
        req - The servlet request.
        res - The servlet response.
        e - The exception that occurred.
        Throws:
        IOException - Can be thrown if a problem occurred trying to write to the output stream.

      • onError

        protected void onError(HttpServletRequest req,
                       HttpServletResponse res,
                       RestException e)
        Callback method for logging errors during HTTP requests.

        ypically, subclasses will override this method and log errors themselves.

        The default implementation simply logs errors to the RestServlet logger.

        Here's a typical implementation showing how stack trace hashing can be used to reduce log file sizes...

        protected void onError(HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse res, RestException e, boolean noTrace) { String qs = req.getQueryString(); String msg = "HTTP " + req.getMethod() + " " + e.getStatus() + " " + req.getRequestURI() + (qs == null ? "" : "?" + qs); int c = e.getOccurrence(); // REST_useStackTraceHashes is disabled, so we have to log the exception every time. if (c == 0) myLogger.log(Level.WARNING, format("[%s] %s", e.getStatus(), msg), e); // This is the first time we've countered this error, so log a stack trace // unless ?noTrace was passed in as a URL parameter. else if (c == 1 && ! noTrace) myLogger.log(Level.WARNING, format("[%h.%s.%s] %s", e.hashCode(), e.getStatus(), c, msg), e); // This error occurred before. // Only log the message, not the stack trace. else myLogger.log(Level.WARNING, format("[%h.%s.%s] %s, %s", e.hashCode(), e.getStatus(), c, msg, e.getLocalizedMessage())); }

        Parameters:
        req - The servlet request object.
        res - The servlet response object.
        e - Exception indicating what error occurred.

      • shouldLog

        protected boolean shouldLog(HttpServletRequest req,
                            HttpServletResponse res,
                            RestException e)
        Returns true if the specified exception should be logged.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own logic for determining when exceptions are logged.

        The default implementation will return false if "noTrace=true" is passed in the query string.

        Parameters:
        req - The HTTP request.
        res - The HTTP response.
        e - The exception.
        Returns:
        true if exception should be logged.

      • shouldLogStackTrace

        protected boolean shouldLogStackTrace(HttpServletRequest req,
                                      HttpServletResponse res,
                                      RestException e)
        Returns true if a stack trace should be logged for this exception.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own logic for determining when stack traces are logged.

        The default implementation will only log a stack trace if RestException.getOccurrence() returns 1 and the exception is not one of the following:

        • HttpServletResponse.SC_UNAUTHORIZED
        • HttpServletResponse.SC_FORBIDDEN
        • HttpServletResponse.SC_NOT_FOUND
        Parameters:
        req - The HTTP request.
        res - The HTTP response.
        e - The exception.
        Returns:
        true if stack trace should be logged.

      • log

        protected void log(Level level,
                   String msg,
                   Object... args)
        Log a message.

        Equivalent to calling log(level, null, msg, args);

        Parameters:
        level - The log level.
        msg - The message to log.
        args - Optional MessageFormat-style arguments.

      • logObjects

        protected void logObjects(Level level,
                          String msg,
                          Object... args)
        Same as log(Level, String, Object...) excepts runs the arguments through JsonSerializer.DEFAULT_LAX_READABLE.

        Serialization of arguments do not occur if message is not logged, so it's safe to use this method from within debug log statements.

        Example:

        logObjects(DEBUG, "Pojo contents:\n{0}", myPojo);

        Parameters:
        level - The log level.
        msg - The message to log.
        args - Optional MessageFormat-style arguments.

      • log

        protected void log(Level level,
                   Throwable cause,
                   String msg,
                   Object... args)
        Log a message to the logger returned by getLogger().

        Subclasses can override this method if they wish to log messages using a library other than Java Logging (e.g. Apache Commons Logging).

        Parameters:
        level - The log level.
        cause - The cause.
        msg - The message to log.
        args - Optional MessageFormat-style arguments.

      • onSuccess

        protected void onSuccess(RestRequest req,
                         RestResponse res,
                         long time)
        Callback method for listening for successful completion of requests.

        Subclasses can override this method for gathering performance statistics.

        The default implementation does nothing.

        Parameters:
        req - The HTTP request.
        res - The HTTP response.
        time - The time in milliseconds it took to process the request.

      • onPreCall

        protected void onPreCall(RestRequest req)
                  throws RestException
        Callback method that gets invoked right before the REST Java method is invoked.

        Subclasses can override this method to override request headers or set request-duration properties before the Java method is invoked.

        Parameters:
        req - The HTTP servlet request object.
        Throws:
        RestException - If any error occurs.

      • onPostCall

        protected void onPostCall(RestRequest req,
                          RestResponse res)
                   throws RestException
        Callback method that gets invoked right after the REST Java method is invoked, but before the serializer is invoked.

        Subclasses can override this method to override request and response headers, or set/override properties used by the serializer.

        Parameters:
        req - The HTTP servlet request object.
        res - The HTTP servlet response object.
        Throws:
        RestException - If any error occurs.

      • handleResponse

        protected void handleResponse(RestRequest req,
                              RestResponse res,
                              Object output)
                       throws IOException,
                              RestException
        The main method for serializing POJOs passed in through the RestResponse.setOutput(Object) method.

        Subclasses may override this method if they wish to modify the way the output is rendered, or support other output formats.

        Parameters:
        req - The HTTP request.
        res - The HTTP response.
        output - The output to serialize in the response.
        Throws:
        IOException
        RestException

      • getSupportedAcceptTypes

        public Collection<MediaType> getSupportedAcceptTypes()
                                              throws RestServletException
        Returns a list of valid Accept content types for this resource.

        Typically used by subclasses during OPTIONS requests.

        The default implementation resturns the list from ParserGroup.getSupportedMediaTypes() from the parser group returned by getParsers().

        Subclasses can override or expand this list as they see fit.

        Returns:
        The list of valid Accept content types for this resource.
        Throws:
        RestServletException

      • getSupportedContentTypes

        public Collection<MediaType> getSupportedContentTypes()
                                               throws RestServletException
        Returns a list of valid Content-Types for input for this resource.

        Typically used by subclasses during OPTIONS requests.

        The default implementation resturns the list from SerializerGroup.getSupportedMediaTypes() from the parser group returned by getSerializers().

        Subclasses can override or expand this list as they see fit.

        Returns:
        The list of valid Content-Type header values for this resource.
        Throws:
        RestServletException

      • getMethodSummary

        public String getMethodSummary(String javaMethodName,
                               RestRequest req)
        Returns the localized summary of the specified java method on this servlet.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own summary.

        The default implementation returns the summary from the following locations (whichever matches first):

        1. @RestMethod.summary() annotation on the method.
        2. [ClassName].[javaMethodName].summary property in resource bundle identified by @RestResource.messages() annotation for this class, then any parent classes.
        3. [javaMethodName].summary property in resource bundle identified by @RestResource.messages() annotation for this class, then any parent classes.
        Parameters:
        javaMethodName - The name of the Java method whose description we're retrieving.
        req - The current request.
        Returns:
        The localized summary of the method, or a blank string if no summary was found.

      • getMethodDescription

        public String getMethodDescription(String javaMethodName,
                                   RestRequest req)
        Returns the localized description of the specified java method on this servlet.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own description.

        The default implementation returns the description from the following locations (whichever matches first):

        1. @RestMethod.description() annotation on the method.
        2. [ClassName].[javaMethodName].description property in resource bundle identified by @RestResource.messages() annotation for this class, then any parent classes.
        3. [javaMethodName].description property in resource bundle identified by @RestResource.messages() annotation for this class, then any parent classes.
        Parameters:
        javaMethodName - The name of the Java method whose description we're retrieving.
        req - The current request.
        Returns:
        The localized description of the method, or a blank string if no description was found.

        public String getTitle(RestRequest req)

        1. @RestResourcel.title() annotation on this class, and then any parent classes.
        2. [ClassName].title property in resource bundle identified by @ResourceBundle.messages() annotation for this class, then any parent classes.
        3. title in resource bundle identified by @RestResource.messages() annotation for this class, then any parent classes.
        4. /info/title entry in swagger file.

        Returns:

        public String getMessage(Locale locale,
                         String key,
                         Object... args)
        Gets a localized message from the resource bundle identified by the @RestResource.messages() annotation.

        If resource bundle location was not specified, or the resource bundle was not found, returns the string "{!!key}".

      • addChildResource

        protected void addChildResource(String name,
                                RestServlet resource)
                         throws ServletException
        Programmatically adds the specified resource as a child to this resource.

        This method can be used in a resources GenericServlet.init() method to define child resources accessible through a child URL.

        Typically, child methods are defined via @RestResource.children(). However, this method is provided to handle child resources determined at runtime.

        Parameters:
        name - The sub-URL under which this resource is accessible.
        For example, if the parent resource URL is "/foo", and this name is "bar", then the child resource will be accessible via the URL "/foo/bar".
        resource - The child resource.
        Throws:
        ServletException - Thrown by the child init() method.

      • getChildResources

        public Map<String,RestServlet> getChildResources()
        Returns the child resources associated with this servlet.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable map of child resources. Keys are the @RestResource.path() annotation defined on the child resource.

      • getPath

        public String getPath()

        If path is not specified, returns "/".

        Path always starts with "/".

        Returns:
        The servlet path.

        protected StreamResource createStyleSheet()
                                   throws IOException
        Creates the stylesheet for this servlet.

        The stylesheet is made available on the path "/servlet-path/style.css".

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own stylesheet.

        The default implementation uses the @RestResource.stylesheet() annotation to determine the stylesheet name and then searches the classpath then working directory for that stylesheet.

        Throws:
        IOException - If stylesheet could not be loaded.

      • createStaticFilesMap

        protected Map<String,String> createStaticFilesMap()
                                           throws ParseException
        Creates the static files map for this servlet.

        This map defines static files that can be served up through subpaths on this servlet. The map keys are subpaths (e.g. "htdocs") and the values are locations to look in the classpath and working directory for those files.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own mappings.

        The default implementation uses the @RestResource.staticFiles() annotation to determine the mappings.

        Returns:
        The list of static file mappings.
        Throws:
        ParseException

        protected JuneauLogger getLogger()
        Returns the logger associated with this servlet.

      • getVarResolver

        protected VarResolver getVarResolver()
        Returns the variable resolver for this servlet created by the createVarResolver() method.

        Variable resolvers are used to replace variables in property values.

        Example:

        @RestResource( messages="nls/Messages", properties={ @Property(name="title",value="$L{title}"), // Localized variable in Messages.properties @Property(name="javaVendor",value="$S{java.vendor,Oracle}"), // System property with default value @Property(name="foo",value="bar"), @Property(name="bar",value="baz"), @Property(name="v1",value="$R{foo}"), // Request variable. value="bar" @Property(name="v2",value="$R{$R{foo}}") // Nested request variable. value="baz" } ) public class MyRestResource extends RestServletDefault {

        A typical usage pattern is using variables for resolving URL links when rendering HTML:

        @RestMethod( name="GET", path="/{name}/*", properties={ @Property( name=HTMLDOC_links, value="{up:'$R{requestParentURI}', options:'?method=OPTIONS', editLevel:'$R{servletURI}/editLevel?logger=$R{attribute.name}'}" ) } ) public LoggerEntry getLogger(RestRequest req, @Path String name) throws Exception {

        Calls to req.getProperties().getString("key") returns strings with variables resolved.

        Returns:
        The var resolver created by createVarResolver().

      • getConfig

        protected ConfigFile getConfig()
        Returns the config file associated with this servlet.
        Returns:
        The resolving config file associated with this servlet, or null if there is no config file associated with this servlet.

      • createVarResolver

        protected VarResolver createVarResolver()
        Creates the reusable variable resolver for this servlet.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own or augment the existing variable provider.

        • $C{...} - Values from the config file returned by getConfig().
        • $S{...} - System properties.
        • $E{...} - Environment variables.
        • $I{...} - Servlet initialization parameters.

        All variables can provide a 2nd parameter as a default value.

        Example: $S{myBooleanProperty,true}".

        Like all other variables, keys and default values can themselves be arbitrarily nested.

        Example: $S{$E{BOOLEAN_PROPERTY_NAME},$E{BOOLEAN_DEFAULT}}".

        Subclasses can augment this list by adding their own variables.

        Example:

        @Override protected StringVarResolver createVarResolver() { StringVarResolver r = super.createVarResolver(); // Wrap all strings inside [] brackets // e.g. "$BRACKET{foobar}" -> "[foobar]" r.addVar("BRACKET", new StringVar() { @Override public String resolve(String varVal) { return '[' + varVal + ']'; } }); return s; }

        Returns:
        The reusable variable resolver for this servlet.

      • createRequestProperties

        protected ObjectMap createRequestProperties(ObjectMap methodProperties,
                                            RestRequest req)
        Creates a properties map for the specified request.

        This map will automatically resolve any "$X{...}" variables using the VarResolver returned by getVarResolver().

        Parameters:
        methodProperties - The method-level properties.
        req - The HTTP servlet request.
        Returns:
        The new object map for the request.

      • getProperties

        public ObjectMap getProperties()
        Returns the class-level properties associated with this servlet.

        Created by the createGuards(ObjectMap) method.

        Notes:
        • The returned Map is mutable. Therefore, subclasses are free to override or set additional initialization parameters in their init() method.

        This method can be called from GenericServlet.init(ServletConfig) or GenericServlet.init().

        Example:

        // Old way of getting a boolean init parameter String s = getInitParam("allowMethodParam"); if (s == null) s = "false"; boolean b = Boolean.parseBoolean(s); // New simplified way of getting a boolean init parameter boolean b = getProperties().getBoolean("allowMethodParam", false);

        Returns:
        The resource properties as an ObjectMap.

      • getResource

        protected InputStream getResource(String name,
                                  Locale locale)
                           throws IOException
        Same as Class.getResourceAsStream(String) except if it doesn't find the resource on this class, searches up the parent hierarchy chain.

        If the resource cannot be found in the classpath, then an attempt is made to look in the JVM working directory.

        If the locale is specified, then we look for resources whose name matches that locale. For example, if looking for the resource "MyResource.txt" for the Japanese locale, we will look for files in the following order:

        1. "MyResource_ja_JP.txt"
        2. "MyResource_ja.txt"
        3. "MyResource.txt"
        Parameters:
        name - The resource name.
        locale - Optional locale.
        Returns:
        An input stream of the resource, or null if the resource could not be found.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getResourceAsString

        public String getResourceAsString(String name,
                                  Locale locale)
                           throws IOException
        Reads the input stream from getResource(String, Locale) into a String.
        Parameters:
        name - The resource name.
        locale - Optional locale.
        Returns:
        The contents of the stream as a string, or null if the resource could not be found.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getResource

        public <T> T getResource(Class<T> c,
                         MediaType mediaType,
                         String name,
                         Locale locale)
                  throws IOException,
                         ServletException
        Reads the input stream from getResource(String, Locale) and parses it into a POJO using the parser matched by the specified media type.

        Useful if you want to load predefined POJOs from JSON files in your classpath.

        Parameters:
        c - The class type of the POJO to create.
        mediaType - The media type of the data in the stream (e.g. "text/json")
        name - The resource name (e.g. "htdocs/styles.css").
        locale - Optional locale.
        Returns:
        The parsed resource, or null if the resource could not be found.
        Throws:
        IOException
        ServletException

      • getSessionObjects

        public Map<String,Object> getSessionObjects(RestRequest req)
        Returns the session objects for the specified request.

        The default implementation simply returns a single map containing {'req':req}.

        Parameters:
        req - The REST request.
        Returns:
        The session objects for that request.
